result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:26 PM - case called.  Defendant Niya Lanier appeared by video, in custody from the Copper Lake School.  Attorney Cana G Kohn appeared by video for Niya Lanier.  Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison appeared on behalf of Attorney Andrew R Polzin for the State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Sgt. Investigator Kevin Orzech duly sworn and testifies.  Direct by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Defendant identified by Sgt. Investigator Orzech.  No cross by Atty Kohn.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Bond will continue.  State calls 21CF325, 21CF326 21CF327 and 21CF328.  Court directs those matters track status conference.
Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
no contact w/victim once released from custody (while in custody incidental contact)
Preliminary hearing on February 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
